page.title: 02Housing/Industry in Glanaman
page.content: Glanaman is situated on the Northern edge of the South Wales coalfield and owes its development to the presence of workable coal seams in the area. Housing has developed in a ribbon pattern along the valley floor; the main street being lined with traditional terraced and/or semi- detached houses. In recent years, many newer houses and bungalows have been built on the peripheries of the village, whilst away from the main thoroughfare, the village retains its country atmosphere with fields, woods and outlying farms. The coal industry has now declined in Glanaman; a landscaped park now stands on what was once the site of the Gelli Ceidrim Colliery. However, many local people are still involved with coal mining in the surrounding area.
